item.title: Astro Bot DLC Release Schedule
item.description:
As of the time of writing, no video game released in 2024 has managed to achieve a higher OpenCritic rating than Astro Bot . Team Asobi's charming yet challenging platformer proved to be a huge hit with both critics and players alike when it was released back in early September, which is perhaps why the news that Astro Bot would be receiving a bunch of free DLC was met with such jubilation by the gaming community.

The Astro Bot DLC will consist of five speedrun stages, each of which contains two new VIP bots. The September State of Play trailer revealed that Eve from Stellar Blade and the Helldivers squad would be among them, but the rest of the cameo characters remain a mystery at this point in time. For those looking forward to finding out and checking out the new challenge stages for themselves, the following Astro Bot DLC release schedule should prove useful.

Astro Bot DLC Release Schedule

The five Astro Bot speedrun stages will be released weekly between October 17 and November 14, going live every Thursday at 6:00 am PT . Unlike a lot of other modern releases, the Astro Bot DLC will drop at the same time for everyone, so release times for those in other regions will vary (see below).

DLC Stage Name

Release Date

Building Speed

October 17, 2024

Let it Slide

October 24, 2024

Spring-loaded Run

October 31, 2024

Helium Heights

November 7, 2024

Rising Heat

November 14, 2024

Astro Bot DLC Release Times

As mentioned above, the Astro Bot DLC will go live on Thursdays at 6:00 am PT. Those living in other time zones can use the following table to work out when they'll be able to start playing the new speedrun stages in their region.

Time Zone

DLC Release Time

Pacific Time (PT)

06:00

Eastern Time (ET)

09:00

British Summer Time (BST)

14:00

Central European Summer Time (CEST)

15:00

Eastern European Summer Time (EEST)

16:00

Japan Standard Time (JST)

22:00

Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST)

23:00

item.title: Nintendo Is Hiring an Intellectual Property Lawyer
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Nintendo is hiring an IP lawyer to handle copyright infringement disputes and protect its business from legal battles.
  • The company has a history of aggressive legal action, issuing DMCA notices and suing many third parties for infringement.
  • The new lawyer may aid in ongoing lawsuits like the one against Palworld or address growing emulation and leak concerns.

Nintendo of America is hiring an intellectual property lawyer to help negotiate and resolve IP disputes. Big game studios are no strangers to legal trouble, especially when it comes to defending their copyrighted material. Nintendo is particularly infamous for hunting down cases of copyright infringement, and it seems it won't reverse that trend anytime soon.

Anyone involved in the Pokemon fan-created game space or who's emulated old N64 titles is likely familiar with the House of Mario 's aggressive legal stance. Over the years, Nintendo has issued DMCA notices to take down content and sued many sites and users for copyright or patent infringement. Now, to no one's surprise, it's continuing that tradition by posting a job posting for legal counsel for its Intellectual Property Group.

The info was shared by fan account Nintendeal on Twitter on October 14. A screenshot of the job listing shows Nintendo is looking for a member of the Washington State Bar Association with at least five years of experience to join the department dedicated to protecting its IPs. That includes managing the outbound copyright infringement cases the company is famous for and protecting the business from any incoming legal disputes. It also covers the far less dramatic processes of conducting in-house training and handling licensing concerns.

The news of the job opening comes right at the heels of several IP-related concerns for the Big N. A rumored multiplayer Pokemon game just leaked online, revealing a slew of private company resources, both new and old. Nintendo has also had ongoing issues with the growing emulator space. As emulators have become increasingly common, the Mario -maker has not backed down from its efforts in trying to take down the site distributing ROMs of its games.

Nintendo Has a Complicated History of Legal Action

It's unclear at this point if the new intellectual property counsel role is related to a plan to ramp up lawsuits amid growing emulation and leak concerns. However, that wouldn't be a stretch to imagine, considering the company's history of legal battles. Just recently, Nintendo sued a modding business, citing piracy laws. It's even gone so far as to take down live streams and videos of its games in the past, calling them unlawful use of their trademarked material. Not every case has worked out in Nintendo's favor, but many of them have, leaving the developer little reason to stop, outside its reputation with gamers.

The role could also be to help with larger lawsuits. In September, Nintendo filed a suit against Palworld over the perceived similarities between the title and Pokemon . Hiring a new lawyer could be a move to improve its standings in that case. Whatever the reasoning may be, the position is still open for now, so how Nintendo uses its expanded legal team has yet to be seen.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Stops Sales and Offers Refunds in One Region
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Activision stops sales of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 in Kuwait and offers refunds for any pre-orders.
  • Kuwait has not approved the game's release; reasons speculated to be related to the Gulf War setting.
  • Activision says it remains hopeful that Kuwait will reconsider its decision.

Activision has confirmed it will be stopping sales and offering refunds for its upcoming shooter, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 , in Kuwait. While Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is just a matter of days away from releasing, the highly-anticipated title has not been approved for release within the country, leading Activision to halt sales and refund all players who had already pre-ordered a copy of the game.

After two years of new Modern Warfare games, developer Treyarch Studios is gearing up for the release of Black Ops 6 on October 25. While the last entry in the series took place during the Cold War, Black Ops 6 will take players on another undercover operation, this time during the outbreak of the Gulf War in 1991. For multiplayer fans, there's a whole new omnidirectional movement system that is set to change Call of Duty in a drastic way, while Zombies fans will finally be able to return to the good old days as two round-based maps will be available at launch.

While the launch of Black Ops 6 is just a few days away, Activision has now confirmed in a new statement (via CharlieIntel) that the game will be unavailable in the country of Kuwait. According to the studio, the shooter "has not been approved for release" and will therefore not be sold within the region. It's not clear exactly why the country denied the release of Black Ops 6 , but Activision has said that all pre-orders within the region will now be canceled and refunded to the original point of purchase. Although the title won't be available in Kuwait at launch, Activision says it "remains hopeful" that the relevant authorities will reconsider the decision in the future.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Stops Sales In Kuwait

While the reasoning behind Kuwait's decision to prevent the game from releasing in the country is unconfirmed, it is speculated that Black Ops 6 's Gulf War setting is the driving force behind the sudden disapproval. Black Ops 6 takes place in 1991, just one year after the beginning of the Gulf War, which was sparked after Iraq invaded Kuwait.

For fans in the rest of the world eagearly anticipating the next entry in the smash hit Call of Duty series, Activision recently confirmed the specific launch times for Black Ops 6 around the world. With October 25 now just a little over a week away, players looking to jump into the shooter as soon as it goes live will be able to pre-load Black Ops 6 on all platforms from October 21 at 9 AM PT.

item.title: Roblox: Titan Wars Tower Defense Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
Even though the recent Skibidi toilet trend has spawned many trivial games on Roblox servers, Titan Wars Tower Defense proves that not everything is so bad. Despite the controversial toilet theme of the game, the gameplay is built around the canonical tower defense system with gacha of unique Cameramen, whose improvement and defense of the fortress is quite good.

In addition, Titan Wars Tower Defense has plenty of unique units, and if Roblox players want to get them as quickly as possible, unique codes will be helpful. Of course, the codes will not make you too strong, since they do not give you things you couldn't get by defeating several dozen waves of enemies. But, it is a great opportunity to make a couple of free rolls and get new units.

Updated October 17, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: Our guide contains only the most recent codes. Use them now and revisit later for more updates.

All Titan Wars Tower Defense Codes

Working Titan Wars Tower Defense Codes

  • 2407 – Enter this code to get 999 Gems and 999 Kills. (NEW)
  • 721 – Enter this code to get 589 Gems and 589 Kills.
  • 706 – Enter this code to get 789 Gems and 789 Kills.
  • camera – Enter this code to get 300 Gems and 100 Kills.
  • twt – Enter this code to get 300 Gems.
  • x3cc – Enter this code to get 300 Gems.
  • titans – Enter this code to get 200 Gems.
  • wars – Enter this code to get 200 Gems.
  • titan – Enter this code to get 150 Gems.

Expired Codes

  • 720 – Enter this code to get 999 Gems and 999 Kills.
  • 714 – Enter this code to get Gems and Kills.
  • 717 – Enter this code to get 500 Gems and 500 Kills.
  • 716 – Enter this code to get 777 Gems and 777 Kills.
  • 715 – Enter this code to get 789 Gems and 789 Kills.
  • 707 – Enter this code to get 999 Gems and 999 Kills.
  • 708 – Enter this code to get 500 Gems and 500 Kills.
  • 709 – Enter this code to get 888 Gems and 888 Kills.
  • 710 – Enter this code to get Gems and Kills.
  • 712 – Enter this code to get Gems and Kills.
  • 713 – Enter this code to get Gems and Kills.
  • clock – Enter this code to get 500 Gems.

How to Redeem Codes for Titan Wars Tower Defense

Fortunately for beginners, the ability to redeem codes in Titan Wars Tower Defense is available from the first seconds of the game. One roll costs only 100 Gems, which means you can get several new units even before the first battle. And if that's what you need, here's how to redeem codes in this tower defense game:

  • Launch Titan Wars Tower Defense in Roblox .
  • Click on the Shop icon on the left side of the screen.
  • Scroll to the very bottom of the page.
  • Enter the code in the Input Code text box.
  • Click Redeem, and you will receive your rewards.

How to Get More Titan Wars Tower Defense Codes

Although X3CC will release new codes to celebrate holidays or upcoming updates, you may miss out on some. Therefore, players are advised to join the official X3CC Roblox group to learn about the latest news before anyone else. In addition, this is a great place to discuss strategies or learn what you might have missed by communicating with other players.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 - The Replacer "Political Analyst" Trailer
item.description: The latest Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 trailer sees the return of The Replacer, who brings gamers the important results of what happens when you mix red and blue in a blender.
